info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 22 at 7:54PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF SCREVEN AND ALLENDALE COUNTIES... At 753 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm over Martin, or 8 miles west of Allendale, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...up to nickel sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Allendale, Sycamore, Ulmer, Seigling, Millett, Martin, Appleton, and Burtons Ferry Landing. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...<45 MPH
info.instruction: Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
